avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow in mountains. The snow that exists has stiffened and gained strength after temperatures dropped.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted. Snow has decreased in mountains and is now presumably homogeneous and stable.  Snow has stiffened and gained even more strength as the temperatures have droped below 0°C. The avalanche danger is considered low.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability is considered good most places. Wind slabs will likely form during snow fall on Monday and Tuesday in strong N-directions.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability of older snow is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegar áttir og frost og lítilsháttar él.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and thawed during warming last week. Little snow is left in the region but some may be added on night to Monday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has melted, thawed and and frozen again. little snow is left in the region. The little snow that is left is considered stable and homogeneous. Low chances of avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability is considered good most places. Wind slabs will likely form during snow fall on Monday and Tuesday in strong N-directions.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability of older snow is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Næstu daga verður áfram kalt. Aðfaranótt mánudags snjóar í hægum vindi á svæðinu en hvessir á mánudagskvöld og þriðjudag í norðan til norðaustanátt.

avalancheActivity.comment: A size 2.5, wet avalanche released likely during warming earlier last week was reported on Saturday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided during thaw last week and is considered stable. Wind slabs may be present in upper elevations and continue forming in snow showers and stiff northerlies after the weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided, melted and refrozen during last weeks thaw and subsequent freezing. The underlying snowpack is considered stable. Wind slabs may be found in the area, and will continue forming in stiff northerlies and snow fall on Monday and Tuesday. In upper elevations, where thaw had less impact, temperature gradient will likely rise in the snowpack, encouraging faceting of weak layers.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability is considered good most places. Wind slabs will likely form during snow fall on Monday and Tuesday in strong N-directions.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability of older snow is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnandi veður heldur áfram næstu daga. Snjókoma og éljagangur á Norður- og Norðausturlandi á mánudag og þriðjudag í hvassri norðanátt.

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches released in Lambeyrardalur above Eskifjörður and Bagall in of Norðfjörður on Monday, January 8th. The same day, multiple rather small loose avalanches released in the area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather and partly melted away. It should widely have become stiff and rather stable. High in mountains, weaknesses can still exist and grow with cooling temperatures. Snow will be added in mountains in a strong NW wind on Tueasday especially in the nothern part of the forcasting area and snow can become unstable for a time.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It got warm up to mountain tops on Sunday and Monday and then, snow subsided and partly melted. Multiple avalanches released during this temperature change. After this thaw, snow should widely have become stiff and rather stable. In the highest mountains, where the effect of the thaw has been less, there is more snow and a possibility for a deeper weakness. At these high elevations, avalanches can become large if they release. Weaknesses can grow with in the snowpack with cooling temperatures. Snow will be added in mountains in a strong NW wind on Tueasday and Wednesday and the snow can have a poor bond with the oldr snow and quickly form into windslabs that may be unstable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability is considered good most places. Wind slabs will likely form during snow fall on Monday and Tuesday in strong N-directions.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles last week. The stability of older snow is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talsverð frost næstu daga og lítilsháttar él. Bætir í úrkomu seinnipart mánudags. Allhvöss eða hvöss NV átt með snjókomu á þriðjudag.
